trans-unit.source: Add entities
trans-unit.target: Add entities

trans-unit.source: Beginner Level Designer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Level Designer

trans-unit.source: After you create a scene, you need to add entities to your scene to build your level.
trans-unit.target: After you create a scene, you need to add entities to your scene to build your level.

trans-unit.source: Create an entity from the Scene Editor
trans-unit.target: Create an entity from the Scene Editor

trans-unit.source: Above the Entity Tree, click the Plus icon.
trans-unit.target: Above the Entity Tree, click the Plus icon.

trans-unit.source: The Create menu opens:
trans-unit.target: The Create menu opens:

trans-unit.source: Scene Editor Create menu
trans-unit.target: Scene Editor Create menu

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, right-click the Entity Tree or anywhere in the scene. If you create an entity in the scene, Game Studio adds an entity in the location you click.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, right-click the Entity Tree or anywhere in the scene. If you create an entity in the scene, Game Studio adds an entity in the location you click.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Entity Tree or scene
trans-unit.target: Right-click Entity Tree or scene

trans-unit.source: Select Empty entity, or select an entity template.
trans-unit.target: Select Empty entity, or select an entity template.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds an entity to the active scene and displays it in the Entity Tree:
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds an entity to the active scene and displays it in the Entity Tree:

trans-unit.source: New Entity in MainScen
trans-unit.target: New Entity in MainScen

trans-unit.source: !Tip The active scene is the scene entities are added to. To set the active scene, Entity Tree (left by default), right-click the scene and select active scene.
trans-unit.target: !Tip The active scene is the scene entities are added to. To set the active scene, Entity Tree (left by default), right-click the scene and select active scene.

trans-unit.source: Set active scene
trans-unit.target: Set active scene

trans-unit.source: The active scene has no effect on runtime.
trans-unit.target: The active scene has no effect on runtime.

trans-unit.source: Create an entity from an asset
trans-unit.target: Create an entity from an asset

trans-unit.source: You can add an entity by dragging and dropping an asset from the Asset View to the scene.
trans-unit.target: You can add an entity by dragging and dropping an asset from the Asset View to the scene.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio automatically creates an entity and adds the required component and reference based on the asset you used. For example, if you drag a model asset to the scene, Game Studio creates an entity with a model component with the model asset as its reference.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio automatically creates an entity and adds the required component and reference based on the asset you used. For example, if you drag a model asset to the scene, Game Studio creates an entity with a model component with the model asset as its reference.

trans-unit.source: !NOTE You can only create entities by dragging assets with corresponding components. For example, model components use model assets, so can be dragged; animations have no corresponding component, so can't be dragged.
trans-unit.target: !NOTE You can only create entities by dragging assets with corresponding components. For example, model components use model assets, so can be dragged; animations have no corresponding component, so can't be dragged.

trans-unit.source: Set up a component
trans-unit.target: Set up a component

trans-unit.source: Components add special properties to entities that define their purpose in your project. For example, you add lights to your scene by adding Light components to entities, add models by adding model components, and so on. An entity with no component has no purpose.
trans-unit.target: Components add special properties to entities that define their purpose in your project. For example, you add lights to your scene by adding Light components to entities, add models by adding model components, and so on. An entity with no component has no purpose.

trans-unit.source: To add a component to an entity:
trans-unit.target: To add a component to an entity:

trans-unit.source: Select the entity.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid, click Add component, and add component you want.
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid, click Add component, and add component you want.

trans-unit.source: Add a component in the Property Grid
trans-unit.target: Add a component in the Property Grid

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the component.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the component.

trans-unit.source: New component in Property Grid
trans-unit.target: New component in Property Grid

trans-unit.source: Set the properties of your new component.
trans-unit.target: Set the properties of your new component.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate an entity
trans-unit.target: Duplicate an entity

trans-unit.source: You can duplicate an entity along with all its properties. Duplicating an entity and then modifying the properties of the new entity is often faster than creating an entity from scratch.
trans-unit.target: You can duplicate an entity along with all its properties. Duplicating an entity and then modifying the properties of the new entity is often faster than creating an entity from scratch.

trans-unit.source: Select the entity you want to duplicate.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity you want to duplicate.

trans-unit.source: Hold Ctrl and move the entity with the mouse.
trans-unit.target: Hold Ctrl and move the entity with the mouse.

trans-unit.source: The entity and all its properties are duplicated.
trans-unit.target: The entity and all its properties are duplicated.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, right-click the entity and select Duplicate selected entities.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, right-click the entity and select Duplicate selected entities.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate selected entities
trans-unit.target: Duplicate selected entities

trans-unit.source: Rename an entity
trans-unit.target: Rename an entity

trans-unit.source: Select the entity and press F2.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity and press F2.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the entity, and then press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the entity, and then press Enter.

trans-unit.source: Renamed entity in a scene
trans-unit.target: Renamed entity in a scene

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
